intro: Polygala amblyptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which is characterized by its distinctive floral structures and often showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, arranged in racemes, and are adapted for pollination by insects. It is well-suited to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
